oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: John T. Wilder corresondence with Martha Wilder, 1864 May 12
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Wilder, John Thomas, 1830-1917
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Letter from J. T. Wilder to his wife Martha describing his march from Chattanooga to Columbia, Tennessee and the small Union skirmishes with Confederate forces for position. John closes his letter with a request for news about a new fence at home and further includes a post script alluding to "trophies" from the Battle of Farmington.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Farmington, Battle of, Tenn, 1863; United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865
Forsyth, Riggs; Grant, Ulysses S. (Ulysses Simpson), 1822-1885
United States. Army
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:spatial: Bridgeport (Ala.); Chattanooga (Tenn.); Columbia (Tenn.); Cumberland Mountains; Lafayette (Tenn.); Lookout Mountain (Appalachian Mountains); Marshall County (Tenn.); Richmond (Va.); Trenton (Tenn.); Villanow (Ga.)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: John T. Wilder correspondence with Martha Wilder, 1861-1865
